title: Forced migration in the twenty-first century

content.prompt: Which of the following describes forced migration?

choices.label: Residents from New Orleans, United States, being displaced during Hurricane Katrina
Residents from Sendai, Japan, being displaced during an earthquake and related tsunami
Population movement to cities with more job opportunities created by economic recession
British convicts shipped to Australia in the mid-eighteenth to mid-nineteenth centuries
Northern Europeans moving to southern European countries for health reasons

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe a relevant geographic concept, process, model, or theory in a specified context.
